citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
On September 27th, 2022, a pig underwent a cricothyrotomy to establish a patent airway as initial intubation was
unsuccessful. However, the cricothyrotomy was not an IACUC approved procedure on the protocol. The review of
proposed animal use activities by the IACUC is required to: (1) ensure that the proposed activities avoid and/or minimize
discomfort, pain, and/or distress to the animals, and (2) determine that the proposed activities meet all the requirements
as described in Sections 2.31(d)(1) and 2.31(e). The IACUC must review and approve those components of proposed
activities related to the care and use of animals.
To be corrected by April 3rd, 2023

citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care.
citations.narrative:
On March 17th, 2022, expired propofol was administered to a calf to achieve an appropriate plane of anesthesia mid
procedure. The use of expired medications could lead to an inadequate level of sedation. The facility must ensure the use
of appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries. This issue was corrected prior to
inspection.

citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care.
citations.narrative:
On June 19th, 2022, lab personnel identified a rabbit with an injury to the right hindlimb. However, the lab personnel failed
to notify the veterinary staff. The animal was identified the next morning by husbandry personnel who alerted the
veterinary staff of the issue. Failure to notify the attending veterinarian in a timely manner can lead to unnecessary animal
pain or suffering. The facility must ensure that there a mechanism of direct and frequent communication with the attending
veterinarian so that problems of animal health, behavior, and well-being are conveyed timely and accurately. This issue
was corrected prior to inspection. This issue was corrected prior to inspection.

On April 2, 2018, 5 transgenic rabbit kits were weaned and separated into new enclosures. One of the separations
included pair-housed females. On April 3, 2018, one of pair-housed females was identified to be missing. The facility
conducted a thorough search, including examination of room drains, but did not locate the rabbit kit. Additionally, the
facility reviewed video footage. However, a definitive cause for the missing rabbit kit was never determined. Inappropriate
handling can affect the animal’s health and well-being. The handling of animals shall be done as expeditiously and
carefully as possible. This issue was corrected prior to inspection.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
End Section

narrative:
2.31(c)(6) 
   
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). 
On September 27th, 2022, a pig underwent a cricothyrotomy to establish a patent airway as initial intubation was 
unsuccessful. However, the cricothyrotomy was not an IACUC approved procedure on the protocol. The review of 
proposed animal use activities by the IACUC is required to: (1) ensure that the proposed activities avoid and/or minimize 
discomfort, pain, and/or distress to the animals, and (2) determine that the proposed activities meet all the requirements 
as described in Sections 2.31(d)(1) and 2.31(e). The IACUC must review and approve those components of proposed 
activities related to the care and use of animals.  
To be corrected by April 3rd, 2023 
2.33(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care. 
On March 17th, 2022, expired propofol was administered to a calf to achieve an appropriate plane of anesthesia mid 
procedure. The use of expired medications could lead to an inadequate level of sedation. The facility must ensure the use 
of appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries. This issue was corrected prior to 
inspection. 
2.33(b)(3) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care.

On June 19th, 2022, lab personnel identified a rabbit with an injury to the right hindlimb. However, the lab personnel failed 
to notify the veterinary staff. The animal was identified the next morning by husbandry personnel who alerted the 
veterinary staff of the issue. Failure to notify the attending veterinarian in a timely manner can lead to unnecessary animal 
pain or suffering. The facility must ensure that there a mechanism of direct and frequent communication with the attending 
veterinarian so that problems of animal health, behavior, and well-being are conveyed timely and accurately. This issue 
was corrected prior to inspection. This issue was corrected prior to inspection. 
2.38(f)(1)  Critical
   
Miscellaneous. 
On April 2, 2018, 5 transgenic rabbit kits were weaned and separated into new enclosures. One of the separations 
included pair-housed females. On April 3, 2018, one of pair-housed females was identified to be missing. The facility 
conducted a thorough search, including examination of room drains, but did not locate the rabbit kit. Additionally, the 
facility reviewed video footage. However, a definitive cause for the missing rabbit kit was never determined. Inappropriate 
handling can affect the animal’s health and well-being. The handling of animals shall be done as expeditiously and 
carefully as possible. This issue was corrected prior to inspection. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
End Section

species.common: DOMESTIC PIG / POTBELLY PIG / MICRO PIG
